The ``email`` address is not currently used, but will be in future releases.

delete.description:
Delete all installed HMM data.

This is not recommended and is used in experimental instances or development. It
won't break analyses that reference the installed HMM data.

get.description:
Finds profile hidden Markov model (HMM) annotations that are used in Virtool for
novel virus prediction.

Providing a search term will return HMMs with full or partial matches in the
`names` attribute.

Each HMM annotation is generated from numerous public viral protein sequences.
The top three most common names in the protein records are combined into the
`names` attribute.

Returns the installation status of the HMM data. Contains the following fields:

| Field      | Type          | Description                                               |
| :--------- | :------------ | :-------------------------------------------------------- |
| `errors`   | array[string] | An array of any errors in the HMM data                    |
| `installed`| object        | A description of the currently installed HMM release      |
| `task.id`  | integer       | The `id` the task responsible for installing the HMM data |
| `release`  | object        | A description of the latest available release             |

**Installed HMM data cannot currently be updated**.
Get the latest release for the HMM data.

get.summary: List all updates applied to the HMM collection

post.summary: Install the latest official HMM database from GitHub

get.description: Retrieves the details for an HMM annotation.

delete.description: Clears completed, failed or all finished jobs.

get.description:
Finds jobs on the instance.

Jobs can be filtered by their current ``state`` by providing desired states as
query parameters.

**Archived jobs are not currently returned from the API**.

delete.description:
Deletes a job.

Jobs that are in an active state (waiting, pending, preparing
running) cannot be deleted. A `409` will be returned if this operation is
attempted.

**We recommend archiving jobs instead of deleting them**. In the future, job
deletion will not be supported.

409.description: Job is running or waiting and cannot be removed

get.description: Retrieves the details for a job.

Find subtractions by their ``name`` or ``nickname`` by providing a ``term`` as a
query parameter. Partial matches are supported.

This endpoint returns paginated results by default.

the subtraction usable in analyses. The subtraction is usable when the
``ready`` property is ``true``.

Accepts file uploads as multipart requests. The request should contain a single
field ``file`` containing the file data.

A file ``name`` and ``type`` must be included in the query string.

Creates the first user for the instance. This endpoint will not succeed more
than once.

After calling this endpoint, authenticate as the first user and use those
credentials to continue interacting with the API.
